channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Will China's Surprise Stimulus Work?
item.description: Getting out of the deflationary hole China dug itself is vital, and in the short run all stimulus will help. But for the long term, China needs to sto...

item.title: I have $2.5 million and fear that I’ll never be able to retire. Am I being irrational?
item.description: A reader needs to visualize his retirement buckets to be sure that he has enough.

item.title: Heard on the Street's Stock-Picking Series
item.description: Check out the stocks Heard on the Street writers favor in their eighth annual stock-picking contest.

item.title: ‘We have no health insurance’: My wife died, leaving behind a lot of medical debt. Am I responsible?
‘I don’t want to spend my remaining days living hand to mouth’: I divorced my husband and remarried. Can I claim his Social Security?
item.description: “I hope that it doesn’t trigger my ex-husband. He has a short fuse.”

item.title: ‘I am beyond hurt’: If my husband and his son die, his house will go to his daughter-in-law. Is this nuts?
item.description: ‘His son, who is a high earner, will need to wait for his inheritance until after I pass away’

item.title: Stocks Are Riding High on Easy Policy. Here's How to Trade It.
item.description: Interest rates are finally coming down. Investors might want to chase the trend, but they don’t need to reach for the most obvious playbook.

item.title: What Trump and Harris say they’ll do to fix the high cost of housing — and what’s worked in the past
item.description: The high cost of housing is a top economic issue that both U.S. presidential candidates have vowed to address.

item.title: The Disruptive Bank Deal Everyone Wanted---Until It Happened
item.description: UniCredit’s effort to buy Germany’s Commerzbank is a test of a broader project to revive Europe’s vitality and stature in the world.

item.title: Rent or Buy? How Falling Mortgage Rates Change the Math
item.description: Rents remain high, but not as high as mortgage payments.
